intro: Geanthus vestitus, commonly known as the naked geanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family, which includes several ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, white pubescence. Geanthus vestitus thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardeners in its native range.
